result.execSummary:
The defendant Brian Francis Anderson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Brian Francis Anderson is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Brian Francis Anderson was found guilty of Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Penalties for Misdemeanors-Class "B"], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
***AMENDED***
October 29, 2015 - wrong count was entered.

Concurrent to 15CM214 and 15CM281.
Defendant to report to Probation.
Bond continues until Defendant reports to Probation.
Court notes 46 days credit against ultimate sentence.

In the event that the defendant is revoked or discharged from either probation or extended supervision with outstanding financial obligations, the supervising agent shall notify the court 10 days prior to the revocation or discharge.  A civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victim(s) and/or governmental entities for any balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect all debt.
Concurrent with: 15CM214 & 15CM281

DNA surcharge.
Complete all Evaluations recommended by Agent and follow through with all therapy and treatment.

CO: RMW, REP: Drost, CLERK: Liddle. ADA:   Michael Edward Nieskes   DF ATTY:  Jeremiah James Harrelson   DF:  Brian Francis Anderson appeared from jail. Case called at 11:05 a.m. Motion filed by Atty Harrelson to release DE on bond while pending appeal. Atty Harrelson gives argument. ADA Nieskes objects. If court is considering a bond, requesting $1,500 cash bond and other conditions. Atty Harrelson gives argument and requesting a signature bond. DE makes statement. Court will grant motion.

*AMENDED*

TO ALSO INCLUDE 15CM214, 15CM281 and 15CM477
-   Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times while this case is ongoing. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia.
-   Report every Wednesday and Saturday before 9:00 a.m. to St Croix County Jail for UA testing, in the presence of an officer or deputy of the same sex and provide a valid/verified UA sample.  If UA tests positive or if a valid/verified sample is not provided, defendant shall submit to additional evidentiary testing to determine the use of substances forbidden by this bond agreement at the jail or Hudson Hospital.  Defendant must pay $5.00 fee at time of each test.
- Maintain residence in the State of Wisconsin
- Update the court within 24 hours of release of current address
- If enrolling in a treatment facility or desire to move out of state, needs to submit request in writing to the court for approval
- Starting Sunday May 22,2016 must seek work at the rate of 5 jobs per week and submit proof to the court. 
- Must maintain employment

  CO: RMW, REP: Drost, CLERK: Liddle .ADA:   Edward Minser   DF ATTY:  Jeremiah James Harrelson   DF:  Brian Francis Anderson appeared from jail. Case called at 9:31 a.m. Court notes this is the date and time set for sentencing on revocation. Court received a revocation order and warrant packet from the probation office. ADA Minser has received a copy and no corrections or additions. Atty Harrelson has received a copy and no corrections or additions. ADA Minser recites recommendations. DE has been sentenced in St Croix Co. Case 15CM692. Requesting jail time run consecutive to that file.  Atty Harrelson gives sentencing arguments. No victims present to make statements today. DE makes statement. Atty Harrelson argues jail credit. Requesting credit from November. ADA Minser argues no double credit. Atty Harrelson will file brief arguing jail credit. Will submit within a week. 20 days to file appeal.  Court orders:

15CM214:
- Impose 90 days jail
15CM477:
- Impose 90 days jail
15CM281:
- Impose 9 months jail

- Sentences in 15CM214, 15CM281 and 15CM477 to run concurrent and consecutive to 15CM692 file. 

- 46 days credit on 15CM477. No additional credit on other files.

CO: RMW, REP: Drost, CLERK: Benoy    9:48  ADA:   Michael Edward Nieskes   DF ATTY:  Jeremiah James Harrelson   DF:  Brian Francis Anderson appeared from jail.   INCLUDES 15CM480, 15CM477, 15CM281 & 15CM214.   Court reads charge and maximum penalty. DE pleads Guilty to Ct 1 in 15CM214, Guilty to Ct 1 in 15CM281 and Guilty to Count 2 in 15CM477.   DE sworn. Crt reviews plea questionnaire and informs DE of rights. Crt finds DE freely, voluntarily and knowingly waives rights and makes plea. Attorney's stipulate to the facts. Crt accepts plea, finds factual basis and finds DE guilty of Ct 2 in 15CM477, Guilty to Ct 1 in 15CM281 and Guilty to Count 1 in 15CM477.   On motion of the State, Crt reads in for restitution purposes and dismisses 15CM480.  Court dismisses Cts 2 & 3 in 15CM281. Sentencing arguments. Crt orders: 

15CM214: S/W 2 years probation, concurrent
-Court costs $243
-DNA surcharge $200

15CM281: S/W 2 years probation, concurrent
-Court costs $243
-DNA surcharge $200

15CM477: S/W 2 years probation, concurrent
-Court costs $243
-DNA surcharge $200
- 46 days credit

Probation conditions:
-complete all evalutaions recommended by probation agent and follow though with all therapy & treatment
- restitution $550; joint and several with Robert Carroll (15CM498)
   DF has 10 days to verify restitution amount and file objection

Bond continues until DF signs up for probation

DF to meet with payment clerk after release
Jury trial at 10-07-2015 08:00 am

Court adjourned at 1:41 p.m. lw  Jury trial scheduled for October 7, 2015 at 08:00 am.

and Motion for Review of Bail/Bond. Filed by Atty Harrelson. km
Filed by Atty Harrelson. Re: PTC on 8/26/2015. km
Appointing Atty Harrelson. km
Pre-trial conference at 08-26-2015 03:15 pm

INCLUDES 15CM477 & 15CM480

It is hereby ordered, as a condition of the defendant's bond/bail in the above-captioned case, that he/she have absolutely NO CONTACT whatsoever with the complaining witness, or with any of the following named persons and/or locations, Christy C. or Shannon S.  The term "no contact" is hereby defined as no contact in person, by telephone, by way of electronic device, email, facsimile, social media including but not limited to texting, Facebook, Twitter, contact through the mail, and/or through a third person.  The aforementioned condition of bond/bail is set pursuant to Sec. 969.02(3)(d), Wis Stats.

Further, it is ORDERED that if the defendant fails to comply with the conditions of his/her bond/bail that he/she may be charged with the offense of bailjumping contrary to Sec. 946.49(1)(a), Wis. Stats.
